results.title: Wintertime
results.brief_description: Nora and her uncle get railroaded into spending the night at a broken-down hotel in Canada. After Nora falls for the handsome owner, she convinces her uncle to invest in the inn and modernize it. After the hotel opens, Nora’s uncle faces financial ruin and her romance hit a snag in the form of pretty reporter.

constellations_primary.name: Ice Queens and Sirens of the sea
constellations_primary.description: Sports stars and mythological creatures on-screen.

results.description: Nora and her uncle get railroaded into spending the night at a broken-down hotel in Canada. After Nora falls for the handsome owner, she convinces her uncle to invest in the inn and modernize it. After the hotel opens, Nora’s uncle faces financial ruin and her romance hit a snag in the form of pretty reporter.

results.title: Winning Your Wings
results.creator_credit: U.S. Army Air Forces, Warner Bros. Pictures, John Huston, Owen Crump and Jack L. Warner
results.brief_description: Winning Your Wings is a 1942 short American World War II recruitment film produced by Warner Bros. Studios for the US Army Air Forces, starring Jimmy Stewart. It was aimed at young men who were thinking about joining the Air Force.

constellations_other.name: The war effort on film
constellations_other.description: Newsreel and documentaries were used as propaganda for the war effort by all sides during WWII, many of them made by major film studios, directors and actors.

results.creator_credit_for_label: U.S. Army Air Forces, Warner Bros. Pictures, John Huston, Owen Crump and Jack L. Warner
results.description: Winning Your Wings is a 1942 short American World War II recruitment film produced by Warner Bros. Studios for the US Army Air Forces, starring Jimmy Stewart. It was aimed at young men who were thinking about joining the Air Force.
description_for_label: Winning Your Wings is a 1942 short American World War II recruitment film produced by Warner Bros. Studios for the US Army Air Forces, starring Jimmy Stewart. It was aimed at young men who were thinking about joining the Air Force.

results.title: Wings
results.creator_credit: Louis D. Lighton, Lucien Hubbard, Hope Loring and Benjamin P. Schulberg
results.brief_description: Two young men, one rich, one middle class, both in love with the same woman, become US Air Corps fighter pilots and, eventually, heroic flying aces during World War I. Devoted best friends, their mutual love of the girl eventually threatens their bond.

constellations_other.name: Directions of storytelling
constellations_other.description: Panoramic slides gave magic lanternists the ability to progress narratives by adjusting slides left or right. This movement is emblematic of a panning shot where the camera follows the action the natural way your head moves.

constellations_other.name: Boom mics, Clara Bow and musicals
constellations_other.description: The microphone was called the "terror of the studios" when sound films were introduced in the late 1920s, but after initial resistance Hollywood fully embraced the new technology.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Louis D. Lighton, Lucien Hubbard, Hope Loring and Benjamin P. Schulberg
results.description: Two young men, one rich, one middle class, both in love with the same woman, become US Air Corps fighter pilots and, eventually, heroic flying aces during World War I. Devoted best friends, their mutual love of the girl eventually threatens their bond. Meanwhile, a hometown girl who’s the lovestruck lifelong next door neighbor of one of them, pines away. Cinema’s first ever gay kiss?
description_for_label: Two young men, one rich, one middle class, both in love with the same woman, become US Air Corps fighter pilots and, eventually, heroic flying aces during World War I. Devoted best friends, their mutual love of the girl eventually threatens their bond. Meanwhile, a hometown girl who’s the lovestruck lifelong next door neighbor of one of them, pines away. Cinema’s first ever gay kiss?

results.title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
results.brief_description: Eccentric candy man Willy Wonka prompts a worldwide frenzy when he announces that golden tickets hidden inside five of his delicious candy bars will admit their lucky holders into his top-secret confectionary.

constellations_other.name: Perception, time and flickering images
constellations_other.description: Using a peep hole and a loop of rotating still images, mutoscopes control the point of view of the audience while also creating the illusion of depth. Filmmakers have since put optical tricks to work creating surreal scenes.

results.description: When eccentric candy man Willy Wonka promises a lifetime supply of sweets and a tour of his chocolate factory to five lucky kids, penniless Charlie Bucket seeks the golden ticket that will make him a winner.
description_for_label: When eccentric candy man Willy Wonka promises a lifetime supply of sweets and a tour of his chocolate factory to five lucky kids, penniless Charlie Bucket seeks the golden ticket that will make him a winner.

results.title: Wild Things
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Kimberly A. Tillman and Edward T. McAvoy
results.brief_description: When teen-socialite Kelly Van Ryan and troubled bad girl Suzie Toller accuse guidance counselor Sam Lombardo of rape, he’s suspended by the school, rejected by the town, and fighting to get his life back. One cop suspects conspiracy, but nothing is what it seems…
results.creator_credit_for_label: Columbia Pictures, Kimberly A. Tillman and Edward T. McAvoy
results.description: When teen-socialite Kelly Van Ryan and troubled bad girl Suzie Toller accuse guidance counselor Sam Lombardo of rape, he’s suspended by the school, rejected by the town, and fighting to get his life back. One cop suspects conspiracy, but nothing is what it seems…

results.title: Widows
results.creator_credit: Euston Films, Thames Television, Carlton Television and Cinema Verity
results.brief_description: Widows was a British primetime television serial aired in 1983, produced by Euston Films for Thames Television and aired on the ITV network. The six-part series revolved was written by crime writer Lynda La Plante.

constellations_other.name: Women, crime and literature
constellations_other.description: Judy & Punch draws on a classic puppet show that's been reframed by director Mirrah Foulkes as a feminist tale, much like the works that put women at the centre in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Euston Films, Thames Television, Carlton Television and Cinema Verity
results.description:
Widows was a British primetime television serial aired in 1983, produced by Euston Films for Thames Television and aired on the ITV network.

The six-part series revolved was written by crime writer Lynda La Plante. The executive producer was Verity Lambert.
description_for_label:
Widows was a British primetime television serial aired in 1983, produced by Euston Films for Thames Television and aired on the ITV network.

The six-part series revolved was written by crime writer Lynda La Plante. The executive producer was Verity Lambert.

results.title: Wicked, Wicked
results.brief_description: A tongue-in-cheek psycho movie in “Duo-vision.” The entire feature employs the split-screen technique used in parts of Brian De Palma’s Sisters that same year.

constellations_other.name: Lois Weber and the split-screen
constellations_other.description: Lois Weber was the third filmmaker to use split screens to show simultaneous action, helping establish it as part of cinematic language, particularly its use in thrillers. It's since been taken to extremes by auteurs and videogames.

results.description: A tongue-in-cheek psycho movie in “Duo-vision.” The entire feature employs the split-screen technique used in parts of Brian De Palma’s “Sisters” that same year. As a handyman at a seacoast hotel, Randolph Roberts wears a monster mask while he kills and dismembers women with blond hair. Tiffany Bolling is a singer, Scott Brady is a detective and Edd “Kookie” Burns is a lifeguard. The music is the original organ score for the silent film “Phantom of the Opera.”
description_for_label: A tongue-in-cheek psycho movie in “Duo-vision.” The entire feature employs the split-screen technique used in parts of Brian De Palma’s “Sisters” that same year. As a handyman at a seacoast hotel, Randolph Roberts wears a monster mask while he kills and dismembers women with blond hair. Tiffany Bolling is a singer, Scott Brady is a detective and Edd “Kookie” Burns is a lifeguard. The music is the original organ score for the silent film “Phantom of the Opera.”

results.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
results.creator_credit: Chenault Productions, Warner Bros. Pictures, Irene Sharaff, T.J. Healy II, Hal W. Polaire, Mike Nichols, Edward Albee, Richard Sylbert and Ernest Lehman
results.brief_description: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use a young couple to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Chenault Productions, Warner Bros. Pictures, Irene Sharaff, T.J. Healy II, Hal W. Polaire, Mike Nichols, Edward Albee, Richard Sylbert and Ernest Lehman
results.description: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use a young couple to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other.

results.title: Whip It
results.brief_description: In Bodeen, Texas, Land Of The Dragon, an indie-rock loving misfit finds a way of dealing with her small-town misery after she discovers a roller derby league in nearby Austin.

constellations_other.name: Aquaman VFX
constellations_other.description: As well as becoming a global box-office sensation, Aquaman (2018) featured groundbreaking visual effects from Australian companies such as Method Studios.

results.description: In Bodeen, Texas, Land Of The Dragon, an indie-rock loving misfit finds a way of dealing with her small-town misery after she discovers a roller derby league in nearby Austin.

results.title: What We Do in the Shadows: Interviews with Some Vampires
results.brief_description: Three vampires who share an apartment are interviewed by a TV crew.
